keywords.keyword: router and switches how to debug using python paramiko
keywords.category: Yes, you can debug using Python paramiko. Paramiko is a library for Python that implements the SSH2 protocol for secure connections to remote machines. It provides support for authenticating and executing commands on remote machines, as well as transferring files over secure connections.

keywords.keyword: give me some python paramiko commands to debug netwrok swiches
keywords.category:
To debug network switches using paramiko, you can use the following commands:

1.  Paramiko.SSHClient().connect() - Establishes a connection to the switch.
2.  Paramiko.SFTPClient.put() - Uploads files to the switch.
3.  Paramiko.SFTPClient.get() - Downloads files from the switch.
4.  Paramiko.exec_command() - Executes commands on the switch.
5.  Paramiko.SFTPClient.close() - Closes the connection with the switch.

keywords.keyword: Give me some specific commands using python and paramiko
keywords.category:
Here are some specific command examples using Python and Paramiko: 
• Create an SSH client instance with Paramiko – ssh = paramiko.SSHClient()
• Connect to a remote host using SSH – ssh.connect(hostname, port, username, password)
• Execute a command on a remote host – stdin, stdout, stderr = ssh.exec_command('command')
• Download a file from a remote host – sftp.get('remotefile.txt', 'localfile.txt')
• Upload a file to a remote host – sftp.put('localfile.txt', 'remotefile.txt')
